lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/duke.main/java/duke.main.duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main.duke.Duke.duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Duke is a simple task management application that allows users to manage their tasks via a command-line interface.
* Users can add, delete, mark as done, and list tasks. Duke also provides basic error handling and data persistence.
* Duke initializes with a {@link Storage} object to handle data storage and retrieval,
* a {@link TaskList} to manage tasks, a {@link Ui} object to handle user interactions,
* and a {@link Scanner} object to read user input from the console.
* To use Duke, simply run the {@link #main(String[])} method. Duke will load existing tasks from the specified
* tasks save file, display a welcome message, and wait for user commands. Users can enter commands such as
* Initializes the UI, task list, storage, and scanner objects.
* Displays a welcome message, loads tasks from the storage file, and waits for user commands.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error loading or saving tasks from/to the storage file.
* Main method to run the Duke application.
* Instantiates a Duke object and invokes its {@link #run()} method.
* The Command class represents an abstract command in the Duke application.
* A command performs an action on the task list, UI, or storage, typically invoked by the user.
* Subclasses of Command implement specific actions such as adding a task, listing tasks, marking tasks as done, etc.
* Each subclass must implement the execute method to perform its specific action.
* Commands can interact with the task list, UI, and storage to execute their actions.
* Executes the command with the given task list, UI, and storage.
* @param taskList the task list to operate on.
* @param ui the user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage the storage for reading from and writing to files.
* @throws InvalidTaskException if the task is invalid.
* @throws InvalidDateException if the date is invalid.
* @throws InvalidIndexException if the index is invalid.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error accessing the storage.
* @throws TaskNotFoundException if the task is not found.
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidTaskException, InvalidDateException, InvalidIndexException, StorageException, TaskNotFoundException;
* The CreateDeadlineTask class represents a command to create a deadline task.
* This command parses the user input to create a deadline task and adds it to the task list.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to create a deadline task.
* @param taskList the task list to add the new task to.
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user.
* @param storage the storage for saving the task.
* @throws InvalidTaskException if the task is invalid.
* @throws InvalidDateException if the date format is invalid.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error accessing the storage.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidTaskException, InvalidDateException, StorageException {
* The CreateEventTask class represents a command to create an event task.
* This command parses the user input to create an event task and adds it to the task list.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to create an event task.
* @param taskList the task list to add the new task to.
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user.
* @param storage the storage for saving the task.
* @throws InvalidTaskException if the task is invalid.
* @throws InvalidDateException if the date format is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidTaskException, InvalidDateException {
* The CreateEventTask class represents a command to create an event task.
* This command parses the user input to create an event task and adds it to the task list.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to create an event task.
* @param taskList the task list to add the new task to.
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user.
* @param storage the storage for saving the task.
* @throws InvalidTaskException if the task is invalid.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error accessing the storage.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidTaskException, StorageException {
* The DeleteTask class represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* This command parses the user input to determine the index of the task to delete and removes it from the task list.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to delete a task.
* @param taskList the task list from which the task will be deleted.
* @param ui the user interface for interacting with the user.
* @param storage the storage for saving the task list after deletion.
* @throws InvalidIndexException if the index of the task to delete is invalid.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error accessing the storage.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidIndexException, StorageException {
* The ExitProgram class represents a command to exit the program.
* This command is used to terminate the program execution.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to exit the program.
* @throws InvalidTaskException if there is an error with tasks.
* @throws InvalidDateException if there is an error with dates.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidTaskException, InvalidDateException {
System.out.println("     Thanks for using, see you again! RAHHH");
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TaskNotFoundException, InvalidIndexException {
* The Help class represents a command to display help information.
* This command displays help information to assist users in understanding how to use the program.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to display help information.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error accessing the storage.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws StorageException {
* The ListTasks class represents a command to list all tasks.
* This command displays all tasks currently in the task list to the user.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to list all tasks.
* @throws InvalidIndexException if there is an error with the task index.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidIndexException {
* The MarkTaskDone class represents a command to mark a task as done.
* This command marks the specified task as done in the task list.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to mark a task as done.
* @throws InvalidIndexException if there is an error with the task index.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error accessing the storage.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidIndexException, StorageException {
* The MarkTaskNotDone class represents a command to mark a task as not done.
* This command marks the specified task as not done in the task list.
* It extends the Command class and implements the execute method to perform its action.
* Executes the command to mark a task as not done.
* @throws InvalidIndexException if there is an error with the task index.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error accessing the storage.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws InvalidIndexException, StorageException {
* The DukeException class represents a custom exception for Duke.
* This exception is used to indicate errors that occur within the Duke application.
* Constructs a new DukeException with the specified detail message.
* The InvalidCommandException class represents an exception indicating an invalid command.
* This exception is thrown when the user inputs an invalid command.
* Constructs a new InvalidCommandException with a default message.
super("Invalid command. Use help to for more info");
* The InvalidDateException class represents an exception indicating an invalid date format.
* This exception is thrown when a date input by the user does not match the expected format.
* Constructs a new InvalidDateException with a default message.
super("Invalid date format. Please use dd-MM-yyyy");
* The InvalidIndexException class represents an exception indicating an invalid index.
* This exception is thrown when an index provided by the user is out of bounds.
* Constructs a new InvalidIndexException with a default message.
super("Index out of bounds. Use list to view all duke.tasks.");
* The InvalidTaskException class represents an exception indicating an invalid task.
* This exception is thrown when the format or content of a task is invalid.
* Constructs a new InvalidTaskException with a default message.
super("Invalid task. Use help for guidance.");
* The StorageException class represents an exception indicating an error in loading or saving a file.
* This exception is thrown when there is an error in loading or saving a file during storage operations.
* Constructs a new StorageException with a default message.
super("Task not found. Use list to view all tasks.");
* The FileUtil class provides methods to display the content of a file.
* It handles file I/O operations and interacts with the Ui to display the content of a file.
* The class provides methods to display the content of a file.
* The file path for the file to be displayed is provided during method call.
* Displays the content of a file.
* @param filePath the file path of the file to display.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error displaying the file.
public static void displayFile(String filePath) throws StorageException {
public static String getResourcePath(String filePath) throws IOException {
throw new IOException("File not found: " + filePath);
* Retrieves the URL of a file.
* @param path the file path of the file to retrieve.
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing user input strings and task data strings into appropriate objects.
* It provides methods to parse user commands, task data from save files, and task details into task objects.
* Additionally, it handles date and time parsing for deadline and event tasks.
* Parses user input into a Command object based on the command type.
* @param userInput the user input string split into an array of strings.
* @return a Command object corresponding to the user input command.
* @throws InvalidCommandException if the user input command is invalid.
public static Command parseUserInput(String[] userInput) throws InvalidCommandException {
* Parses task data from a save file into a Task object.
* @param taskStringData the task data string read from the save file.
* @return a Task object parsed from the task data string.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error parsing the task data.
* @throws InvalidDateException if the task data contains an invalid date.
public static Task parseSaveFile(String taskStringData) throws StorageException, InvalidDateException {
* Parses a saved to-do task in text file with the given information.
* This method creates a new to-do task based on the provided description. If the task
* is marked as done (i.e., {@code isDone} is {@code true}), it sets the task as done.
* @param isDone      {@code true} if the task is marked as done, {@code false} otherwise.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
private static Task parseSavedToDoTask(boolean isDone, String description) {
* Parses a saved deadline task with the given information.
* This method extracts the deadline information from the provided {@code deadlineSection},
* creates a new deadline task with the specified description and deadline, and marks it
* as done if {@code isDone} is {@code true}.
* The deadline information is expected to be in the format "(by: deadline)", where
* "deadline" represents the date and time of the task's deadline.
* @param isDone           {@code true} if the task is marked as done, {@code false} otherwise.
* @param description      The description of the deadline task.
* @param deadlineSection  The section of the saved task containing the deadline information.
* @throws InvalidDateException If the deadline date and time cannot be parsed.
* @throws StorageException     If the deadline section does not contain valid deadline information.
private static Task parseSavedDeadlineTask(boolean isDone, String description, String deadlineSection) throws InvalidDateException, StorageException {
* Parses a saved event task with the given information.
* This method extracts the start and end date/time information from the provided {@code eventSection},
* creates a new event task with the specified description, start date/time, and end date/time,
* and marks it as done if {@code isDone} is {@code true}.
* The event information is expected to be in the format "(from: startBy to: endBy)", where
* "startBy" represents the start date and time of the event, and "endBy" represents the end date
* @param isDone        {@code true} if the task is marked as done, {@code false} otherwise.
* @param description   The description of the event task.
* @param eventSection  The section of the saved task containing the event information.
* @throws InvalidDateException If the start or end date/time cannot be parsed.
* @throws StorageException    If the event section does not contain valid event information.
private static Task parseSavedEventTask(boolean isDone, String description, String eventSection) throws InvalidDateException, StorageException {
Task task = new EventTask(description, Parser.parseDateTime(startBy), Parser.parseDateTime(endBy));
* Parses user input details into a ToDoTask object.
* @param details an array of strings containing task details.
* @return a ToDoTask object parsed from the task details.
* @throws InvalidTaskException if the task details are invalid.
public static ToDoTask parseTodoTask(String[] details) throws InvalidTaskException {

public static DeadlineTask parseDeadlineTask(String[] details) throws InvalidTaskException, InvalidDateException {

* Parses user input details into an EventTask object.

* The Storage class manages the loading and saving of tasks to and from a file.
* It handles file I/O operations and interacts with the TaskList to manage tasks.
* The class provides methods to load tasks from a specified file, save tasks to the same file,
* and create the file if it does not exist.
* The file path for storing tasks is provided during object instantiation.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path and task list.
* @param filePath the file path to store tasks.
* @param taskList the task list to manage tasks.
* Loads tasks from the file specified in the file path.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error loading tasks from the file.
* Saves tasks to the file specified in the file path.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error saving tasks to the file.
* Creates a new save file if it does not exist.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error creating the save file.
* The Ui class handles user interaction and display functionalities for the Duke application.
* It provides methods to display start-up messages, graphical elements, and error messages,
* as well as to parse and store user commands.
* Displays the start-up message for the Duke application.
* This method displays the application's logo and a greeting message.
* @throws StorageException if there is an error loading graphical resources.
public final void displayStart() throws StorageException {
System.out.println("      What can I do for you today?\n");

* @param doneBy the deadline date of the task.
* Returns the deadline date of the task.

* The EventTask class represents a task that occurs within a specified time frame.
* It extends the Task class and adds attributes for the start and end dates of the event.
* An event task includes a description, a start date, and an end date.
* Constructs an EventTask with the specified description, start date, and end date.
* @param description the description of the event task.

* The Task class represents a general task with a description and completion status.
* A task can be marked as done or not done, and it includes a description and a done icon.
* This class serves as the base class for specific types of tasks such as deadline tasks and event tasks.
* Tasks can be marked as done or not done, and their completion status can be updated accordingly.
* The class provides methods to retrieve the task description, done icon, and to update the completion status.
* Note: The done icon is represented as "[ ]" for not done and "[X]" for done.
* Constructs a Task with the specified description.
* @param description the description of the task.
* Updates the done icon based on the completion status of the task.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns the done icon representing the completion status of the task.
* @return the done icon of the task.

* @return a string representation of the task.
* The TaskList class represents a list of tasks.
* It extends the ArrayList class to store tasks and provides methods for adding, retrieving, displaying, and deleting tasks.
* The class includes methods to add tasks, retrieve tasks by index, display all tasks, and delete tasks by index.
* Tasks in the list are indexed starting from 1 for user-friendly display purposes.
* Note: This class extends ArrayList<Task> to inherit list operations and behavior.
* Adds a task to the task list.
